channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: 1960s pop star Connie Francis has died. The singer's life was touched by tragedies
item.description: 1960s pop star Connie Francis has died. The first female singer to chart a number-one single on the Billboard Hot 100, she sold over 40 million records before the age of 25.
item.content:encoded: 1960s pop star Connie Francis has died. The first female singer to chart a number-one single on the Billboard Hot 100, she sold over 40 million records before the age of 25.
item.dc:creator: Jeff Lunden

item.title: Rescission package heads to final vote. And, Trump floats firing the Fed chairman
item.description: The Senate voted to approve a rescission package that claws back funds allocated for public media and foreign aid. And, President Trump floats the idea of firing the Federal Reserve chair.
item.content:encoded:
The Senate voted to approve a rescission package that claws back funds allocated for public media and foreign aid. And, President Trump floats the idea of firing the Federal Reserve chair.

(Image credit: Michael M. Santiago/Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: StoryCorps' David Isay reacts to the Senate's vote to cut funding for public media
item.description: NPR's Steve Inskeep and Michel Martin speak with David Isay, founder and president of StoryCorps, about the Senate vote to cut funding for public broadcasting.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Steve Inskeep and Michel Martin speak with David Isay, founder and president of StoryCorps, about the Senate vote to cut funding for public broadcasting.
item.dc:creator: Michel Martin

item.title: Israel launches airstrikes on the Syrian capital of Damascus
item.description:
Israel launched airstrikes Wednesday on Syria's capital of Damascus, saying it targeted the Syrian military headquarters and near the presidential palace in response to attacks on the Druze minority.

This segment originally aired July 16, 2025.
item.content:encoded:
Israel launched airstrikes Wednesday on Syria's capital of Damascus, saying it targeted the Syrian military headquarters and near the presidential palace in response to attacks on the Druze minority.

This segment originally aired July 16, 2025.
item.dc:creator: Daniel Estrin

item.title: Stand back! This explosive cucumber is bursting with seeds
item.description: A small, hairy, toxic version of the cucumbers found in the produce aisle does have an advantage over its more palatable cousins — a feat of ballistic seed dispersal.
item.content:encoded:
A small, hairy, toxic version of the cucumbers found in the produce aisle does have an advantage over its more palatable cousins — a feat of ballistic seed dispersal.

(Image credit: Stanislav Gorb)
item.dc:creator: Ari Daniel

item.title: Virginia is for … data centers? Residents are increasingly saying no
item.description: The world's highest concentration of data centers is in Virginia. Many residents are not happy about that.
item.content:encoded:
The world's highest concentration of data centers is in Virginia. Many residents are not happy about that.

(Image credit: Ryan Murphy)
item.dc:creator: Ryan Murphy

item.title: Maryland taps Affordable Care Act fund to help pay for abortion care
item.description: Like other states that still allow abortion, Maryland has seen an increase in people coming from out of state to get care. And it's found a new way to offer them financial support.
item.content:encoded:
Like other states that still allow abortion, Maryland has seen an increase in people coming from out of state to get care. And it's found a new way to offer them financial support.

(Image credit: Jonathan Newton/For The Washington Post)
item.dc:creator: Scott Maucione

item.title: Ari Aster's 'Eddington' takes the tension of the pandemic to a violent end
item.description: In pandemic-era New Mexico, a sheriff (Joaquin Phoenix) and a mayor (Pedro Pascal) face off against one another, and their differences boil over into chaos.
item.content:encoded:
In pandemic-era New Mexico, a sheriff (Joaquin Phoenix) and a mayor (Pedro Pascal) face off against one another, and their differences boil over into chaos.

(Image credit: Ari Aster and Darius Khondji)
item.dc:creator: Phil Harrell

item.title: Senate approves cuts to NPR, PBS and foreign aid programs
item.description: The Senate voted to approve a $9 billion rescission package aimed at clawing back money already allocated for public radio and television.
item.content:encoded:
The Senate voted to approve a $9 billion rescission package aimed at clawing back money already allocated for public radio and television.

(Image credit: J. Scott Applewhite)
item.dc:creator: Scott Neuman

item.title: Gulf Coast braces for flooding as storm builds into possible tropical depression
item.description: The weather system moving across the Florida Panhandle on Wednesday was showing a greater chance of becoming a tropical depression as it moves toward the northern Gulf Coast.
item.content:encoded:
The weather system moving across the Florida Panhandle on Wednesday was showing a greater chance of becoming a tropical depression as it moves toward the northern Gulf Coast.

(Image credit: AP)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
